===Getting Started Guide===

  # Configure the following properties in filter-local.properties, filter-dev.properties, and filter-prod.properties.
    * google.app.id
    * google.jsapi.http.key
    * google.jsapi.https.key
    * application.hostname
    * mail.fromAddress
  # Create a settings.xml and a settings-security.xml in your local .m2 folder. See [http://maven.apache.org/guides/mini/guide-encryption.html Maven - Password Encryption] for instructions on how to encrypt your GAE password.
{{{
<!-- settings.xml -->
<settings xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/SETTINGS/1.0.0"
    xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
    xsi:schemaLocation="http://maven.apache.org/SETTINGS/1.0.0
        http://maven.apache.org/xsd/settings-1.0.0.xsd">
  
    <servers>
        <server>
            <id>yourapp.com</id> <!-- this should match the google.app.id property and is the GAE application id -->
            <username>you@yourapp.com</username> <!-- GAE username -->
            <password>encryptedpass</password> <!-- Encrypted GAE password -->
        </server>    
    </servers>

</settings>
}}}
{{{
<!-- settings-security.xml -->
<settingsSecurity>
    <master>masterpass</master> <!-- Encrypted master password -->
</settingsSecurity>
}}}
  # Run _gae:unpack_ to place the google app engine sdk into your local .m2 repository
  # Run _mvn clean compile -P local_ to create a new local build
  # Run _mvn clean gae:run -P local_ to run locally
  # Run _mvn gae:stop -P local_ to stop the local jetty server
  # Run _mvn clean gae:deploy -P dev_ to deploy to your dev app engine app
  # Run _mvn clean gae:deploy -P prod_ to deploy to your prod app engine app

Notes: 
  # jsapi keys can be obtained [http://code.google.com/apis/ajaxlibs/documentation/index.html#sign_up_for_an_api_key here].
  # To demonstrate the localization functionality just append the following to any url: _/some/url?locale=en_US_ or _/some/url?locale=tl_PH_. To support additional locales just create a new _messages_xx_YY.properties_ and set the new locale via _/some/url?locale=xx_YY_.

===JRebel Usage===
  # Install the [http://www.zeroturnaround.com/jrebel/early-access/ JRebel Nightly Build (3.6-SNAPSHOT)].
  # Define a REBEL_HOME environment variable
  # Run _mvn clean gae:run -P local-jrebel_ to run locally with JRebel support

===Remote API/Bulk Loader Usage===
Below is an example of how to use the Bulk Loader tool to copy all the user account entities from the production server to the local development server. Omit the "--kind" option to dump/restore all kinds.
  * Backup: 
  {{{
    bulkloader.py --dump --application=appid --url=https://appid.appspot.com/remote_api --kind=UserAccount --filename=backup.dat
  }}}
  * Restore:
  {{{
    bulkloader.py --restore --application=appid --url=http://localhost:8080/remote_api --kind=UserAccount --filename=backup.dat
  }}}
